text:
R. 767, International Hojise,
500 Riverside Drive,
New York 27., N.Y., U.S.
June 29th 1963
Dear Mr. Fellows,
Thank you very much for the two checks, which I
was happy to receive.
By the way, I mailed a claim for Reiiabursement for
Travelling Expenses to you on 25th June. Mr. Gregory
wrote the letter for me and I have only just noticed that
he addressed you as 'Dear Jim'. Please excuse this
unintentional familiarity^
I shall now be leaving New York on 31st July.
Yours sincerely
